description:
In compute/manager.py the function wrap_instance_event() just calls function().

This means that if it's used to decorate a function that returns a value, then the caller will never see the return code.
title: wrap_instance_event() swallows return codes

comments.content:
In compute/manager.py the function wrap_instance_event() just calls function().

This means that if it's used to decorate a function that returns a value, then the caller will never see the return code.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cbf123

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/89943
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~openstack-gerrit

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/89943
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=71ef9b6541a43897ac433762eb4e2193515b40fa
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 71ef9b6541a43897ac433762eb4e2193515b40fa
Author: Chris Friesen <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Apr 23 14:15:04 2014 -0600

    wrap_instance_event() shouldn't swallow return codes
    
    The wrap_instance_event() function, when used as a decorator,
    will currently swallow return codes.  This prevents it from
    being used on a function that returns a value that the caller
    actually cares about.
    
    Change-Id: I72616b0afcd3ab8fae81742bf4b7754cd959ef3a
    Closes-Bug: 1311793
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
